resources.string: \t\tCoronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by a new virus that had not been previously identified in humans.

\t\tThe virus causes respiratory illness (like the flu) with symptoms such as a cough, fever and in more severe cases, pneumonia. You can protect yourself by washing your hands frequently and avoiding touching your face.
\t\tThe new coronavirus spreads primarily through contact with an infected person when they cough or sneeze, or through droplets of saliva or discharge from the nose.

You can reduce your risk of infection if you: 
‣ Clean hands frequently with alcohol-based hand rub or soap and water 
‣ Cover nose and mouth when coughing and sneezing with tissue or flexed elbow 
‣ Avoid close contact (1 metre or 3 feet) with anyone with cold or flu-like symptoms

If you have mild symptoms, stay at home until youâ€™ve recovered. You can relieve your symptoms if you:
 ‣ rest and sleep 
 ‣ keep warm 
 ‣ drink plenty of liquids 
 ‣ use a room humidifier or take a hot shower to help ease a sore throat and cough
\t\tIf you develop a fever, cough, and have difficulty breathing, promptly seek medical care. Call in advance and tell your health provider of any recent travel or recent contact with travelers.
